channel.title: dump on rbxmk
channel.description: Recent content in dump on rbxmk

item.title: fragments
item.description: rbxmk dump fragments The fragments dump format lists the fragment references made by the program. A fragment is a chunk of text that documents some particular element. Internally, fragments are represented by a collection of files. A fragment reference is a combination of a file path, which drills into the file tree, and a “section” path, which drills into the sections of the referred file. The following top-level directories are defined:

item.title: json
item.description: rbxmk dump json The json dump format describes the API of the Lua environment in JSON format. The top-level value is a JSON object. The Version field is a number that signals the structure of the JSON format, and will be present in all versions of the format. Run rbxmk doc "Commands/dump/json:Version 0" for a detailed description of the structure. Flags # indent # --indent string Default: "\t" Specifies the spacing used to indent the JSON output.

item.title: plugin
item.description: rbxmk dump plugin FILE The plugin command enables the generation of a custom dump format. The command receives a file to be executed as a Lua script. rbxmk dump plugin script.lua If - is given as the file, then the script will be read from standard input instead. echo 'print("hello world!")' | rbxmk dump plugin - The script receives as arguments a table and a function. local dump, write = .

item.title: selene
item.description: rbxmk dump selene The selene dump format produces a TOML-formatted configuration file for the selene linter that lints the rbxmk Lua environment.
